intro: Diglyphosa evrardii, commonly known as the two-lobed lichen, is a unique species belonging to the family Lecanoraceae. It is characterized by its foliose thallus, which is typically greenish-yellow in color and has a leathery texture. The plant forms a symbiotic relationship with algae, which provides it with photosynthetic capabilities. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found on tree trunks and rocks in temperate regions. Due to its specialized habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
